intro: Mesosphaerum lappulaceum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Mesosphaerum lappulaceum plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is sometimes used in restoration projects.
